quizzes.title: COLREG - Collision Avoidance Rules
quizzes.description: Basic questions about maritime collision avoidance rules

questions.question: What color is the starboard sidelight?
questions.explanation: According to COLREG Rule 23, the starboard sidelight must be green.

questions.question: What is the maximum horizontal range of a masthead light?
questions.explanation: For vessels up to 50m, the masthead light range is typically 5 nautical miles.

questions.question: At what angle does an all-round light shine?
questions.explanation: An all-round light shines in all directions - 360 degrees.

questions.question: What does a power-driven vessel display when underway?
questions.explanation: A power-driven vessel underway displays a masthead light, sidelights (red and green), and a sternlight.

questions.question: Which color is the port sidelight?
questions.explanation: According to COLREG Rule 23, the port sidelight must be red.

questions.question: A vessel not under command displays how many red all-round lights?
questions.explanation: A vessel not under command displays two red all-round lights in a vertical line.

questions.question: What does the sternlight show?
questions.explanation: The sternlight shows abaft the beam - 135 degrees (112.5 degrees on each side of the stern).

questions.question: At anchor, a vessel displays which lights?
questions.explanation: A vessel at anchor displays one all-round white light (for vessels under 50m) at the best visible position.

questions.question: A fishing vessel trawling displays lights in what pattern?
questions.explanation: A fishing vessel engaged in trawling displays green all-round light above a white all-round light in vertical line.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the BOW arrow indicator?
options: Indicate the vessel's heading and bow position
questions.explanation: The BOW arrow shows the front (bow) of the vessel and indicates its heading direction.
